intro: Psychotria silhetensis, commonly known as Silhet psychotria, is a species of flowering plant native to the subtropical regions of South Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale green. It is often found in moist, shaded forest understories and is adapted to thrive in humid environments. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
